laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked decrease in immunoglobulins; no significant elevation in white blood cell count or C-reactive protein, indicating absence of inflammatory markers.
Hypoxemia with a PaO2 of 62.6 Torr under 6 L/min of oxygen.
Normal ranges for CD3 and CD19 cell counts.
Increased lymphocyte count of 49% in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid; negative cultures for bacteria and fungi.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Pathological diagnosis from transbronchial lung biopsies
laboratory_examinations.findings: Diverse inflammatory cell infiltration mainly composed of lymphocytes and granulomatous infiltration of macrophages; no necrosis.
Significant improvement in the infiltrates and ground-glass opacities in both lungs.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement was noted from initial CT findings of diffuse infiltrates and ground-glass opacities.
